Parts of Speech.question: Which word is a noun in the sentence: 'The cat sleeps on the sofa'?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Cat’ is the name of an animal, so it is a noun.

Parts of Speech.question: Which word is a verb?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Run’ shows an action, so it is a verb.

Parts of Speech.question: Identify the adjective: 'She wore a beautiful dress.'
Which word is a pronoun?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘He’ is used in place of a noun.

Parts of Speech.question: Identify the preposition: 'The book is on the table.'
Identify the noun: 'Honesty is the best policy.'
Which part of speech is the word 'they'?
Identify the verb: 'Birds fly in the sky.'
Which word is an adverb in 'He speaks softly'?
Identify the conjunction: 'I tried but failed.'
Identify the part of speech of the underlined word: He has **already** finished the work.
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Already’ modifies the verb ‘finished’, so it is an adverb.

Parts of Speech.question: Which word functions as a noun in the sentence: 'Swimming is good for health'?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Swimming’ is a gerund acting as a noun.

Parts of Speech.question: Identify the conjunction in the sentence: 'He is poor yet honest.'
Which word is used as an adjective: 'This is a sleeping dog'?
Identify the preposition: 'He sat beside me.'
Which word is an abstract noun?
Identify the pronoun in the sentence: 'Each of the boys was rewarded.'
Which word is a modal auxiliary verb?
Identify the adjective: 'She bought an expensive car.'
Which word is a relative pronoun?
Which word is a collective noun?
Identify the preposition in the sentence: 'The train passed through the tunnel.'
Which word is an interrogative pronoun?
Which word is a transitive verb?
Identify the adverb in the sentence: 'He spoke loudly.'
Which word is a demonstrative pronoun?
Identify the adjective: 'The blind man crossed the road.'
Which word is an adverb of manner?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Slowly’ tells how an action is done.

Parts of Speech.question: Identify the conjunction: 'He will pass if he works hard.'
Which word is a proper noun?
Identify the verb: 'The baby is sleeping.'
Which word is an adverb of time?
Which word is a compound preposition?
Identify the adjective: 'He gave me little money.'
Which word is a reflexive pronoun?
Which word is an auxiliary verb?
Which word is an adjective used as a noun: 'The rich should help the poor'?
Which word is a numeral adjective?
Identify the conjunction: 'Neither Ram nor Shyam was present.'
Which word is an adverb modifying an adjective?
Which word is a linking verb?
Which word is an emphatic pronoun?
Which word is a finite verb?
Identify the preposition used for cause:
Which word is an adjective phrase head?
Identify the conjunction: 'Hard work as well as luck is needed.'
Which word is an adverbial interrogative?
Which word is a preposition of direction?
Identify the adjective used for emphasis:
Which word is a coordinating conjunction?
Which word is an interjection expressing approval?
Which word is a reciprocal pronoun?
Identify the adverb modifying another adverb:
Which word is a subordinating conjunction?
Which word is a noun denoting profession?
Identify the adjective used as a complement:
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Happy’ completes the meaning of the subject.

Parts of Speech.question: Which word is an adverb of reason?
Which word is a noun of state?
Which word is an interjection expressing surprise?
Identify the adjective modifying a gerund:
Which word is an adverbial phrase?
Identify the noun functioning as an adjective:
Which word is a causative verb?
Which word is an adverb of affirmation?
Which word is a noun phrase head?
Identify the adverb used as a conjunction:
Which word is a preposition of concession?
Which word is an interjection used in greeting?
Identify the adjective modifying a pronoun:
Which word is an adverb of condition?
Which word is a conjunctive adverb?
Which word is an interjection expressing pain?
Identify the adjective used as a predicate:
Which word is an adverbial noun?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘Today’ acts as an adverb of time.

Parts of Speech.question: Identify the preposition used for instrument:
Which word is an adjective of emphasis?
Which word is an interjection expressing agreement?
Identify the adverb modifying a verb phrase:
Which word is a noun used as subject complement?
Which word is a phrasal preposition?
Parts of Speech.explanation: ‘In front of’ is a phrasal preposition.

Parts of Speech.question: Which word is an interjection expressing sorrow?
Identify the adjective modifying an infinitive:
Which word is an adverb of probability?
Which word is a subordinating conjunction of contrast?
Which word is an interjection expressing warning?

Which word is an adverbial clause introducer?

Which word is an interjection expressing call for attention?

Which word is an adverb of sequence?
Which word is a conjunction used in pairs?
Which word is an interjection expressing request?

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: He is senior than me in service.
Find the error: She is good in mathematics.
Find the error: Each of the students have submitted the form.
Find the error: He did not wrote the letter.
Find the error: She prefers tea than coffee.
Find the error: One of my friend lives here.
Find the error: He is one of the best player in the team.
Find the error: I have seen him yesterday.
Error Spotting.explanation: Present perfect not used with past time.

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: She did not knew the answer.
Find the error: He has been working here since five years.
Error Spotting.explanation: ‘Since’ is used with point of time; use ‘for’.

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: The news are very encouraging.
Find the error: He gave me many informations.
Find the error: She is more better than her sister.
Find the error: No sooner he reached the station than the train left.
Find the error: She suggested me to apply again.
Error Spotting.explanation: ‘Suggest’ is not followed by indirect object.

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: The teacher as well as the students were present.
Find the error: He is suffering with fever.
Find the error: She does not knows my address.
Find the error: The child was afraid from the dog.
Find the error: He ordered for a cup of tea.
Find the error: Either of the answers are correct.
Find the error: He did the work hardly.
Find the error: She is married with a doctor.
Find the error: He is capable to do this work.
Find the error: I shall be grateful if you will help me.
Find the error: He denied to take the money.
Find the error: She insisted to pay the bill.
Find the error: He is addicted with smoking.
Find the error: She is one of those who believes in hard work.
Find the error: He is more intelligent than any boy in the class.
Find the error: I look forward to meet you.
Find the error: He has completed the work before two days.
Find the error: She is senior than all other teachers.
Find the error: He ran fastly to catch the bus.
Find the error: She is my cousin sister.
Find the error: The price of these books are high.
Find the error: He is working in this office from 2018.
Find the error: She did a mistake in the calculation.
Find the error: He is suffering by malaria.
Find the error: She cannot bear from the pain.
Find the error: He is more superior than his colleagues.
Find the error: She is angry upon me.
Find the error: He reached late to the office.
Find the error: She explained me the rule.
Find the error: He is fond to music.
Find the error: She is good looking girl.
Find the error: He was absent since Monday.
Find the error: She can speak English very fluent.
Find the error: He did not replied to my letter.
Find the error: She is elder than me.
Find the error: He is confident to success.
Find the error: She has no any idea about it.
Find the error: He ordered me that I should go.
Find the error: She is suffering with headache.
Find the error: He is a man of few words.
Find the error: She resembles with her mother.
Find the error: He is lacking of experience.
Find the error: She is used to live alone.
Find the error: He has no less than ten cars.
Find the error: She is comparatively better than him.
Find the error: He along with his friends were arrested.
Find the error: She is good in singing.
Find the error: He is junior than me.
Find the error: She is married since 2015.
Find the error: He is very much tired.
Find the error: She did not went there.
Find the error: He is superior than his brother.
Find the error: She is angry on him.
Find the error: He is addicted of drugs.
Find the error: She is one of the cleverest girl in the class.
Find the error: He discussed about the issue.
Find the error: She entered into the room.
Find the error: He returned back the money.
Find the error: She emphasized on the main point.
Find the error: He is in the habit to wake up early.
Find the error: She has a good command over English.
Find the error: He is guilty for the crime.
Find the error: She is lacking behind in studies.
Find the error: He is acquainted to my father.
Find the error: She is proud for her achievements.
Find the error: He is anxious of his result.
Find the error: She differs with me on this point.
Find the error: He has no faith on his luck.
Find the error: She is married with a rich man.
Find the error: He is incompetent to do this job.
Error Spotting.explanation: Use ‘incompetent to’ is acceptable but standard is ‘incompetent to do’ (correct).

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: She is interested for music.
Find the error: He is aware about the consequences.
Find the error: She congratulated him for his success.
Find the error: He is jealous with his brother.
Find the error: She is famous for her honesty.
Find the error: He is busy in his work.
Find the error: She is known with her generosity.
Find the error: He is angry at me for no reason.
Find the error: She is responsible of the loss.
Find the error: He is confident of success.
Find the error: She is annoyed on his behavior.
Find the error: He is angry against injustice.
Error Spotting.explanation: Sentence is acceptable in exam context.

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: She is cleverer of the two sisters.
Error Spotting.explanation: Use ‘cleverer of the two’ (correct) → error is none? Exam expects ‘No error’?

Error Spotting.question: Find the error: He is the most intelligent of all the boys.
Find the error: She is not as clever than her sister.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He is senior than me in service.
options: He is senior to me in service.
He was senior than me in service.
He is senior from me in service.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She did not knew the reason.
options: She did not know the reason.
She does not knew the reason.
She did not known the reason.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: Each of the boys were given a prize.
options: Each of the boys was given a prize.
Each of the boys are given a prize.
Each of the boy were given a prize.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He is suffering with fever.
She prefers tea than coffee.
options: She prefers tea over than coffee.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: The news are very shocking.
He is one of the best player of the team.
options: He is one of the best players of the team.
He is one of best player of the team.
He was one of the best player of the team.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She is more better than her sister.
options: She is better than her sister.
She is more good than her sister.
She is much better than her sister.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He ordered for a cup of tea.
options: He ordered a cup of tea.
He ordered to a cup of tea.
He orders for a cup of tea.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She is married with a doctor.
options: She is married to a doctor.
She was married with a doctor.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: I look forward to meet you.
options: I look forward to meeting you.
I look forward for meeting you.
I am looking forward meet you.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He has no any money.
She did a mistake in calculation.
options: She made a mistake in calculation.
She committed a mistake in calculation.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He is junior than me.
She can speak English very fluent.
options: She can speak English very fluently.
She can speak English very fluent language.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He returned back the money.
options: He returned the money back again.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She is angry upon me.
He discussed about the problem.
options: He was discussed about the problem.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She insisted to pay the bill.
options: She insisted on paying the bill.
She insisted for paying the bill.
She insisted to paid the bill.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: He is suffering by malaria.
She is good in mathematics.
He has been working here since five years.
options: He has been working here for five years.
He has been working here from five years.
He is working here since five years.
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: ‘For’ is used with period of time.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She is elder than me.
He reached late to the station.
options: He reached late at the station.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: She explained me the rule.
options: She explained the rule to me.
She explained me about the rule.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) He is / (b) senior than me / (c) in service / (d) No error
(a) Each of the students / (b) have submitted / (c) the application / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: ‘Each’ takes a singular verb → has submitted.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) He did not / (b) knew the answer / (c) to the question / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Base form is used after ‘did’ → know.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) She is married / (b) with a doctor / (c) since 2015 / (d) No error
(a) The news / (b) are very / (c) encouraging / (d) No error
(a) One of my friends / (b) have gone / (c) abroad / (d) No error
(a) He is suffering / (b) with fever / (c) for two days / (d) No error
(a) She prefers tea / (b) than coffee / (c) in the morning / (d) No error
(a) He has been working / (b) in this office / (c) since five years / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Use ‘for’ with a period of time.

(a) He ordered / (b) for a cup / (c) of tea / (d) No error
(a) She did / (b) a mistake / (c) in calculation / (d) No error

(a) He is / (b) one of the best player / (c) in the team / (d) No error

(a) He is / (b) jealous with his brother / (c) always / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) proud for her achievements / (c) in life / (d) No error

(a) He is / (b) confident to success / (c) in the exam / (d) No error
(a) She has / (b) a good command / (c) over English / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) lacking of experience / (c) in this field / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) used to live alone / (c) nowadays / (d) No error
(a) He along with / (b) his friends / (c) were arrested / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) busy in her work / (c) these days / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) famous for / (c) his honesty / (d) No error
(a) She differs / (b) with me / (c) on this matter / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) annoyed on her behavior / (c) yesterday / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) cleverer of the two sisters / (c) in studies / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) not as clever than / (c) his brother / (d) No error
(a) Each of the boys / (b) were given / (c) a prize / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: ‘Each’ takes a singular verb → was given.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) Neither Ram nor / (b) his friends / (c) was present there / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Verb agrees with nearest subject → were present.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) He is / (b) one of the students / (c) who works hard / (d) No error
(a) The teacher / (b) as well as the students / (c) are present / (d) No error
(a) Scarcely had / (b) he reached the station / (c) than the train left / (d) No error
(a) No sooner / (b) did he arrive / (c) when it started raining / (d) No error
(a) Hardly had / (b) she entered the room / (c) when everyone stood up / (d) No error
(a) He denied / (b) to take the money / (c) from the table / (d) No error
(a) She suggested / (b) me to apply / (c) for the post / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Use ‘suggested that I apply’ or ‘suggested applying’.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) He insisted / (b) to go there alone / (c) despite objections / (d) No error
(a) She is senior / (b) than me / (c) in the office / (d) No error
(a) This is / (b) the most unique / (c) idea I have heard / (d) No error
(a) He prefers / (b) tea than coffee / (c) in the morning / (d) No error
(a) The population of India / (b) are increasing / (c) very rapidly / (d) No error
(a) The committee / (b) have taken / (c) its decision / (d) No error
(a) One should / (b) do his duty / (c) honestly / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) taller and stronger / (c) of the two brothers / (d) No error
(a) She does not know / (b) where has he gone / (c) after the meeting / (d) No error
(a) I do not know / (b) what is his name / (c) exactly / (d) No error
(a) The train / (b) reached at the platform / (c) on time / (d) No error
(a) He has been working / (b) in this office / (c) since five years / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) suffering from fever / (c) from two days / (d) No error
(a) He did not / (b) attend the meeting / (c) due to he was ill / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) too much intelligent / (c) for this job / (d) No error
(a) He is / (b) as good if not better / (c) than his brother / (d) No error
(a) The news / (b) are very shocking / (c) to everyone / (d) No error
(a) Mathematics / (b) are my favourite subject / (c) in school / (d) No error
(a) The furniture / (b) were sold / (c) at a low price / (d) No error
(a) She is / (b) more smarter / (c) than her sister / (d) No error
(a) This is / (b) the very first time / (c) I saw him / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Use present perfect → ‘I have seen him’.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) He ran / (b) fastly to catch / (c) the bus / (d) No error
(a) She speaks / (b) English very fluent / (c) in interviews / (d) No error
(a) He ordered / (b) for a cup of tea / (c) immediately / (d) No error
(a) She emphasized / (b) on the need / (c) for discipline / (d) No error
(a) He was / (b) prevented to enter / (c) the hall / (d) No error
(a) She accused him / (b) for stealing the money / (c) from the drawer / (d) No error
(a) He succeeded / (b) in passing the exam / (c) despite of hardships / (d) No error
Mixed Error & Improvement.explanation: Use ‘despite hardships’ or ‘in spite of hardships’.

Mixed Error & Improvement.question: (a) She is / (b) looking forward to / (c) meet you soon / (d) No error
(a) He suggested / (b) that the work / (c) is completed early / (d) No error
(a) It is high time / (b) we take a decision / (c) regarding this issue / (d) No error

Tenses.question: He usually _____ to office by bus.
Tenses.explanation: Simple Present tense is used for habitual actions.

Tenses.question: She _____ her homework before dinner yesterday.
Tenses.explanation: Past Perfect shows an action completed before another past action.

Tenses.question: They _____ for the train when it started raining.
Tenses.explanation: Past Continuous shows an ongoing action in the past.

Tenses.question: I _____ this book already.
By next year, he _____ his degree.
Tenses.explanation: Future Perfect indicates completion before a future time.

Tenses.question: She _____ TV when I called her.
He _____ here since 2015.
We _____ the match tomorrow.
The baby _____ all night.
She _____ the office before I arrived.
Tenses.explanation: Past Perfect shows earlier past action.

Tenses.question: I _____ him at the station last night.
Tenses.explanation: Simple Past for definite past time.

Tenses.question: They _____ in this house for ten years before shifting.
Tenses.explanation: Past Perfect for duration before another past action.

Tenses.question: Look! The sun _____.
Tenses.explanation: Present Continuous for action happening now.

Tenses.question: By the time you arrive, we _____ the work.
Tenses.explanation: Future Perfect for completed future action.

Tenses.question: The patient _____ before the doctor arrived.
He said that he _____ the work already.
She will not go unless he _____ her.
I wish I _____ more time to study.
Tenses.explanation: Wish expressing present regret → past tense.

Tenses.question: He _____ since morning, that is why he is tired.
Tenses.explanation: Present Perfect Continuous for ongoing duration.
